stream_context.summary: Kaze programs and polishes several overworld features: a coin-gated cannon door, a new star-unlock particle effect, and an animated intro cut-scene that morphs from 2D storybook pages to a 3D island. He demoed a newly finished level on real N64 hardware, discussed memory/optimization plans, and noted that dialogue handling is currently broken.

development_findings.summary: A full overworld level was completed off-stream; Diablox contributed significant work to it.
development_findings.quote: I basically finished this level here off-screen, but I have to admit, a lot of this is also Diablox work and not just my own.

development_findings.summary: The project will be open-sourced after completion; current RTY-specific code remains private.
development_findings.quote: This right now is not open source yet. It will be open source though, once it's done.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is implementing a coin-gated cannon: a Black Bob-omb NPC patrols, asks for 200 coins, and unlocks the cannon if paid.
development_findings.quote: I want this to cost coins, like it's important to me that some things just cost money.

development_findings.summary: A new star-unlock effect was prototyped: multiple stars scale, orbit Mario, then shower him with pixie-dust particles.
development_findings.quote: All stars should do this instead, right? That looks so much better than a normal star animation.

development_findings.summary: Planned intro: 3D scenes transition into hand-drawn storybook pages, then fade back to a 3D island before gameplay.
development_findings.quote: Then the storybook alpha overlay disappears slowly to reveal the island below it in 3D.

development_findings.summary: Memory budget for storybook images calculated (~0.5 MB raw; compression and CI8 tiling will halve it). 4–7 MB free remain in ROM.
development_findings.quote: We have around 4 megabytes left… If Redz does the compression thing, then we get like another 4 megabytes.

development_findings.summary: Upcoming optimisation: converting engine math from 4×4 to 4×3 matrices for speed and cache savings.
development_findings.quote: Maybe after this stream, [I'll] turn all the 4x4 matrices finally into 4x3 matrices.

development_findings.summary: Dialogue system refactor broke question/answer prompts; must be fixed off-stream before NPCs function.
development_findings.quote: I might have just broken this. I changed a lot about dialogues.

development_findings.summary: Yoshi rescue progression: island starts with 1 Yoshi, jumps to 11 after first Bowser, and increases as player advances.
development_findings.quote: You start with one Yoshi… after you beat the first Bowser level, there's, I think, 11 Yoshis on the island.

development_findings.summary: Water surface will eventually use WaveRace-style visuals; technical details still unclear.
development_findings.quote: WaveRace 64 water physics are not difficult to implement… Actually, I'm not sure I understand the full extent of the WaveRace water physics.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s work ethic: motivation is irrelevant—just work.
context_findings.quote: If you need motivation, you're already fucked up. Why do you need to feel motivated to work?

context_findings.summary: He relocated to Canada for programming; migration was easy due to his profession.
context_findings.quote: I am a programmer. And migrating here was fairly easy.

context_findings.summary: He streams 1–3 times a week at 2 p.m. local time and often shows real N64 hardware.
context_findings.quote: My streams are always around 2 p.m. my local time… I'm going to show it to you on a real Nintendo 64.

context_findings.summary: He distrusts PowerPoint/Microsoft and worries about shared account security.
context_findings.quote: PowerPoint is such a fucking joke… One day, someone who's just sharing accounts with me is gonna do some bad stuff, and I'm gonna get into trouble.

biobak.summary: Provided storyboards for the Yoshi memory flashback and uploads assets/textures via Discord.
Actively communicates with Kaze during stream; pinch alert indicates frequent real-time collaboration.

badub.summary: Composer expected to handle music/sound for key scenes such as the boat-eaten cut-scene.
badub.quote: Oh yeah, I'm sure Badub can pull that up.

zeina.summary: Appears briefly; mood noted but no direct project input during this stream.

key_stories.title: The Storybook Intro Pivot
key_stories.summary: Kaze and Biobak decide to transform the opening cut-scene into a hybrid 2D/3D storybook that fades into the playable island.
key_stories.challenge: Standard static intro felt bland and memory-heavy.
key_stories.process: Reviewed Biobak’s storyboard, brainstormed 2D panels fading into 3D, calculated ROM/RAM costs, planned CI8 compression and streaming.
key_stories.outcome: Concept accepted; implementation notes recorded for future work.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine this is a 3D scene… then the storybook overlay disappears to reveal the island below it in 3D.

key_stories.title: Coin-Gated Cannon and the Corrupt Bob-omb
key_stories.summary: Kaze prototypes an NPC that charges 200 coins to unlock a cannon, adding an economy layer to exploration.
key_stories.challenge: Needed a meaningful coin sink and thematic gate for cannon access.
key_stories.process: Placed patrolling Black Bob-omb, scripted dialogue states, set up payment logic; discovered dialogue refactor bug.
key_stories.outcome: NPC behaviour coded but blocked by broken dialogue system; fix deferred off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I want this to cost money—some things should just cost money.

open_questions.topic: Technical implementation of the storybook cut-scene
open_questions.context: High-level concept approved; details on asset pipeline, streaming, and performance unresolved.
